results.title: Men and science
results.brief_description: An overview of the work of Australian scientists, with special emphasis upon research on the Australian fur seal and the scope and variety of research undertaken by the C.S.I.R.O.

results.title: Men and mobs
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: From the small flocks raised by the early settlers in New South Wales, the wool and fat lamb industry of Australia has grown to its present importance in the nations economy. “Men and mobs” tells the story of sheep in Australia from the time of the first poorly-fleeced animals brought by Governor Phillip, and alter, the first merinos introduced by Captain Macarthur, until today, when buyers from all over the world compete to purchase the annual woolclip.

results.title: Men and Masculinity
results.brief_description: A Two Part documentary that examines the changing roles of men in our society. Part 1, “Men and Masculinity”, looks at social conditioning and the image of a stereotypical male. Part 2, titled “Men and Intimacy”, looks at men and their personal relationships.

results.title: Men against the ice
results.brief_description: The conquest of the Artic Sea, beginning with attempts by early seafarers to thread their way through dangerous channels in search of a north-west passage across the North American Continent. Exploration by sea and air, right up to most recent developments. A forecast is made by Michael Marsden of the Artic Institute of North America. He sees the atomic-powered submarine paving the way for the industrial development of oil recourses in the Arctic.

results.title: Men & women in the business: the gender clash within the workplace
results.brief_description: Using Canada as an example, this video presents an informative look at the interaction between males and females in the workplace. It uses a seminar on communication between the sexes held with the Bank of Commerce- CIBC. They uncover issues such as the clash between male and female culture, gender differences and expectations, gender gripe lists of the opposite sex, how men and women listen differently, male confusion over a changed workplace and the need to change the traditional male culture of the organisation. The seminar proves to be useful to the organisation and they feel better equipped to deal with gender differences in the workplace.

results.title: Memory packs
results.brief_description:
This CD-ROM was created with funding by the Commonwealth Government through the Australia council - its arts and funding advisory body, and by the City of Port Philip Cultural Development Fund.
The work is an interactive exhibition of objects that evoke stories or memories. Young people, old people, people from diverse backgrounds, artists, entertainers, the famous, the infamous and the not yet discovered - all were asked to contribute an object of personal significance and a story to accompany it. The CD-ROM has a linked website (www.experimenta.org/gallery/memorypacks/description.html).

results.title: Memory lingers on (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the latest research into the workings of the brain. Examines the memory capacity of the brain and probes such questions as “Does memory remain the same over the years?”, “How does memory influence everyday actions”, and “Is the script for the future already written - from memory?” Also gives details of how external stimuli are processed by the brain.
